paper.title: Learning relations from noisy examples: an empirical comparison of LINUS and FOIL

author.org: Jozef Stefan, Institute Jamova 39, 61000 Ljubljana, Yugoslavia
Jozef Stefan, Institute Jamova 39, 61000 Ljubljana, Yugoslavia

paper.abstract: Abstract Algorithms for learning relations have only recently addressed the problem of learning from noisy data. LINUS and FOIL are two such systems, which are based on approaches from attribute-value learning algorithms. The paper presents an empirical comparison of their performance on the problem of learning illegal chess endgame positions from noisy examples.
